intro: Barnadesia trianae, commonly known as the Triana's barnadesia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
